metadata.title: CVE-2022-40674 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
libexpat before 2.4.9 has a use-after-free in the doContent function inxmlparse.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40674` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.5.0-1
libexpat1 - 2.5.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cadaver package in oracular is affected and may need fixing.
coin3 package in oracular is affected and may need fixing.
expat package in oracular was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.0-1').
gdcm package in oracular is affected and may need fixing.
libxmltok package in oracular is affected and may need fixing.
matanza package in oracular is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in oracular is affected and may need fixing.
tdom package in oracular is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
wbxml2 package in oracular is affected and may need fixing.
xmlrpc-c package in oracular is affected and may need fixing.
